intro: Erigeron rhodopaeus, commonly known as the Greek fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in summer, adding a delicate touch to its habitat. Erigeron rhodopaeus is often found in open woodlands, grasslands, and along coastal areas.
